prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. 1. Define the coordinate system with euler angles as (0, 0, 0) and translation vector as (0, 0, 0). 2. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a rectangle by creating four lines (loop_1) with the following end points: - line_1: (0, 0) to (0.75, 0) - line_2: (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.225) - line_3: (0.75, 0.225) to (0, 0.225) - line_4: (0, 0.225) to (0, 0) 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Extrude the sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.009 towards the normal and a sketch scale of 0.75. Part 2: Create a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism is positioned diagonally from the top left to the bottom right corner of the image. The cylindrical hole is centered horizontally and vertically within the prism. The prism has a flat top and bottom surface. The cylindrical hole has a flat bottom surface and a curved top surface. The prism is slightly larger than the cylindrical hole. 1. Define the coordinate system with euler angles as (0, 0, 0) and translation vector as (0, 0, 0.009). 2. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw four rectangles on the sketch, two of them with 0.03 width and one with dimensions covered by the sketch. Divide the rectangles into loops as (loop_1 and loop_2) for the 0.03 width rectangles and (loop_3 and loop_4) for the full width rectangle. - For loop_1 and loop_2 draw lines with the following end points: - rectangle 1: (0, 0) to (0.03, 0) and (0.03, 0) to (0.03, 0.03) - rectangle 2: (0.72, 0.225) to (0.75, 0.225) and (0.75, 0.225) to (0.75, 0.195) - For loop_3 and loop_4 draw lines with the following end points: - rectangle 3: (0.72, 0) to (0.75, 0) and (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.03) - rectangle 4: (0, 0.195) to (0.03, 0.195) and (0.03, 0.195) to (0.03, 0.225) 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Extrude the sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.3375 towards the normal, a sketch scale of 0.75, and a 'Join' operation with the previous body.</description>
